intro: Gasteranthus otongensis, commonly known as the "Otongensis urn plant," is a species of flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its unique, urn-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, with simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are adapted for specific pollination mechanisms, primarily by birds such as hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
